bitfield.description: 0 = disconnected. 1-15 = connected to channelID = CHANID.

bitenum.description: 0 is an allowed value, signifying that the event is unconnected
A value of 0 specifies that the event is not connected
Consult your device datasheet as the actual allowed maximum may be less than 255.

bitfield.description: 0 = disconnected. 1-15 = connected to channelID = CHANID.

bitenum.description: 0 is an allowed value, signifying that the event is unconnected
A value of 0 specifies that the event is not connected
Consult your device datasheet as the actual allowed maximum may be less than 255.

bitfield.description: Enable the power
Clear the RESETSTKY bit in the STAT register
Assert reset to the peripheral
ADC sample clock source selection.

bitenum.description: SYSOSC is the source of ADC sample clock.
ULPCLK is the source of ADC sample clock.
HFCLK clock is the source of ADC sample clock.

bitfield.description: CCONRUN: Forces SYSOSC to run at base frequency when device is in RUN mode which can be used as ADC sample or conversion clock source.

bitenum.description: ADC conversion clock source is not kept continuously on during RUN mode.
ADC conversion clock source kept continuously on during RUN mode.

bitfield.description: CCONSTOP: Forces SYSOSC to run at base frequency when device is in STOP mode which can be used as ADC sample or conversion clock source.

bitenum.description: ADC conversion clock source is not kept continuously on during STOP mode.
ADC conversion clock source kept continuously on during STOP mode.

bitfield.description: This bit indicates, if the peripheral was reset, since this bit was cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register

bitenum.description: The peripheral has not been reset since this bit was last cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register
The peripheral was reset since the last bit clear

bitfield.description: Interrupt index status

bitenum.description: No bit is set means there is no pending interrupt request
Primary Sequence In range comparator interrupt
DMA done interrupt, generated on DMA transfer completion,

bitfield.description: Mask INIFG in MIS_EX register.

Raw interrupt flag for the MEMRESx result register being below than the WCLOWx threshold of the window comparator. This bit is reset to 0 by IIDX read or when corresponding bit in ICLR_EX is set to 1.

Raw interrupt flag for the MEMRESx result register being higher than the WCHIGHx threshold of the window comparator. This bit is reset to 0 by IIDX read or when corresponding bit in ICLR_EX is set to 1.
Raw interrupt flag for MEMRESx overflow. This bit is reset to 0 by IIDX read or when corresponding bit in ICLR_EX is set to 1.
Raw interrupt flag for MEMRESx underflow. This bit is reset to 0 by IIDX read or when corresponding bit in ICLR is set to 1.
Raw interrupt flag for sequence conversion timeout overflow. This bit is reset to 0 by IIDX read or when corresponding bit in ICLR_EX is set to 1.
Raw interrupt flag for DMADONE. This bit is reset to 0 by IIDX read or when corresponding bit in ICLR_EX is set to 1.

Raw interrupt status for MEMRES0. This bit is set to 1 when MEMRES0 is loaded with a new conversion result. Reading MEMRES0 register will clear this bit, or when the corresponding bit in ICLR is set to 1

bitenum.description: A new data is ready to be read.

bitfield.description: Event line mode select for event corresponding to IPSTANDARD.INT_EVENT0

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. Software must clear the RIS.
The interrupt or event line is in hardware mode. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Event line mode select for event corresponding to IPSTANDARD.INT_EVENT1

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. Software must clear the RIS.
The interrupt or event line is in hardware mode. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Minor rev of the IP
Major rev of the IP
Instance Number within the device. This will be a parameter to the RTL for modules that can have multiple instances
Feature Set for the module *instance*
Module identification contains a unique peripheral identification number. The assignments are maintained in a central database for all of the platform modules to ensure uniqueness.
Enable conversion

bitenum.description: Conversion disabled. ENC change from ON to OFF will abort single or repeat sequence on a MEMCTLx boundary. The current conversion will finish and result stored in corresponding MEMRESx.
Conversion enabled. ADC sequencer waits for valid trigger (software or hardware).

bitfield.description: Power down policy

bitenum.description: ADC is powered down on completion of a conversion if there is no pending trigger
ADC remains powered on as long as it is enabled through software.

bitfield.description: Sample clock divider
Sample trigger source
Start of conversion

bitenum.description: When SAMPMODE is set to MANUAL, clearing this bit will end the sample phase and the conversion phase will start. When SAMPMODE is set to AUTO, writing 0 has no effect.

When SAMPMODE is set to MANUAL, setting this bit will start the sample phase. Sample phase will last as long as this bit is set. When SAMPMODE is set to AUTO, setting this bit will trigger the timer based sample time.

bitfield.description: Conversion sequence mode

bitenum.description: ADC channel in MEMCTLx pointed by STARTADD will be converted once
ADC channel sequence pointed by STARTADD and ENDADD will be converted once
ADC channel in MEMCTLx pointed by STARTADD will be converted repeatedly
ADC channel sequence pointed by STARTADD and ENDADD will be converted repeatedly

bitfield.description: Sample mode. This bit selects the source of the sampling signal. MANUAL option is not valid when TRIGSRC is selected as hardware event trigger.

bitenum.description: Sample timer high phase is used as sample signal
Software trigger is used as sample signal

bitfield.description: Hardware averager numerator. Selects number of conversions to accumulate for current MEMCTLx and then it is divided by AVGD. Result will be stored in MEMRESx.

bitenum.description: Averages 2 conversions before storing in MEMRESx register
Averages 4 conversions before storing in MEMRESx register
Averages 8 conversions before storing in MEMRESx register
Averages 16 conversions before storing in MEMRESx register
Averages 32 conversions before storing in MEMRESx register
Averages 64 conversions before storing in MEMRESx register
Averages 128 conversions before storing in MEMRESx register

bitfield.description: Hardware averager denominator. The number to divide the accumulated value by (this is a shift). Note result register is maximum of 16-bits long so if not shifted appropirately result will be truncated.
Data read-back format. Data is always stored in binary unsigned format.

bitenum.description: Digital result reads as Binary Unsigned.
Digital result reads Signed Binary. (2s complement), left aligned.

bitfield.description: Resolution. These bits define the resolutoin of ADC conversion result. Note : A value of 3 defaults to 12-bits resolution.

Sequencer start address. These bits select which MEMCTLx is used for single conversion or as first MEMCTL for sequence mode. The value of STARTADD is 0x00 to 0x17, corresponding to MEMRES0 to MEMRES23.

bitenum.description: MEMCTL0 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL1 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL2 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL3 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL4 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL5 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL6 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL7 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL8 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL9 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL10 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL11 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL12 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL13 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL14 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL15 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL16 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL17 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL18 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL19 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL20 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL21 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL22 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
MEMCTL23 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.

bitfield.description: Sequence end address. These bits select which MEMCTLx is the last one for the sequence mode. The value of ENDADD is 0x00 to 0x17, corresponding to MEMRES0 to MEMRES23.

bitenum.description: MEMCTL0 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL1 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL2 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL3 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL4 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL5 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL6 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL7 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL8 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL9 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL10 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL11 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL12 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL13 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL14 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL15 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL16 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL17 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL18 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL19 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL20 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL21 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL22 is selected as end address of sequence.
MEMCTL23 is selected as end address of sequence.

bitfield.description: Enable DMA trigger for data transfer. Note: DMAEN bit is cleared by hardware based on DMA done signal at the end of data transfer. Software has to re-enable DMAEN bit for ADC to generate DMA triggers.
Number of ADC converted samples to be transferred on a DMA trigger
Enable FIFO based operation
Frequency Range.

Specifies the number of sample clocks. When VAL = 0 or 1, number of sample clocks = Sample clock divide value. When VAL > 1, number of sample clocks = VAL x Sample clock divide value. Note: Sample clock divide value is not the value written to SCLKDIV but the actual divide value (SCLKDIV = 2 implies divide value is 4). Example: VAL = 4, SCLKDIV = 3 implies 32 sample clock cycles.

Specifies the number of sample clocks. When VAL = 0 or 1, number of sample clocks = Sample clock divide value. When VAL > 1, number of sample clocks = VAL x Sample clock divide value. Note: Sample clock divide value is not the value written to SCLKDIV but the actual divide value (SCLKDIV = 2 implies divide value is 4). Example: VAL = 4, SCLKDIV = 3 implies 32 sample clock cycles.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary format has to be used. The value based on the resolution has to be right aligned with the MSB on the left. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bits have to be 0s.
If DF = 1, 2s-complement format has to be used. The value based on the resolution has to be left aligned with the LSB on the right. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bits have to be 0s.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary format has to be used. The threshold value has to be right aligned, with the MSB on the left. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bit have to be 0s.
If DF = 1, 2s-complement format has to be used. The value based on the resolution has to be left aligned with the LSB on the right. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bit have to be 0s.
Input channel select.
Trigger policy. Indicates if a trigger will be needed to step to the next MEMCTL in the sequence or to perform next conversion in the case of repeat single channel conversions.
Voltage reference selection. VEREFM must be connected to on-board ground when external reference option is selected. Note: Writing value 0x3 defaults to INTREF.
Enable window comparator.
Enable burn out current source.
Enable hardware averaging.
Selects the source of sample timer period between SCOMP0 and SCOMP1.
Busy. This bit indicates that an active ADC sample or conversion operation is in progress.

bitenum.description: No ADC sampling or conversion in progress.
ADC sampling or conversion is in progress.

bitfield.description: Indicates reference buffer is powered up and ready.

MEMRES result register. If DF = 0, unsigned binary: The conversion results are right aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused MSB bits are forced to 0. If DF = 1, 2s-complement format: The conversion results are left aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused LSB bits are forced to 0. The data is stored in the right-justified format and is converted to the left-justified 2s-complement format during read back.
